column2: For each recently-acquired province in your demesne that is not within your capital duchy, you will be prompted about whether to automatically distribute its titles. You may individually skip any such province in the process, leaving manual management of the province to you. No titles higher than count-tier will ever be distributed.

For each recently-acquired province in your demesne that is not within your capital duchy, you will be prompted about whether to automatically distribute its titles. You may individually skip any such province in the process, leaving manual management of the province to you. No titles higher than count-tier will ever be distributed.

For each recently-acquired province in your demesne that is not within your capital duchy, automatically grant the province's titles to new, [Root.Culture.GetName]-[Root.Religion.GetName] characters until you no longer exceed your demesne limit. If you want to keep granting beyond that point (below your demesne limit), invoke the decision again. Note that this automatic behavior is specific to multiplayer: in singleplayer, among numerous other differences, you are prompted about each province before granting it.

For each recently-acquired province in your demesne that is not within your capital duchy, automatically grant the province's titles to new, [Root.Culture.GetName]-[Root.Religion.GetName] characters (regardless of excess demesne capacity). Note that this automatic behavior is specific to multiplayer: in singleplayer, among numerous other differences, you are prompted about each province before granting it.
Grant Recently Acquired Land to Locals

For each recently-acquired province in your demesne that is not within your capital duchy, automatically grant the province's titles to new characters, each a local to the province being given out, until you no longer exceed your demesne limit. If you want to keep granting beyond that point (below your demesne limit), invoke the decision again. Note that this automatic behavior is specific to multiplayer: in singleplayer, among numerous other differences, you are prompted about each province before granting it.
Grant Recently Acquired Land to Locals (All)

For each recently-acquired province in your demesne that is not within your capital duchy, automatically grant the province's titles to new characters (regardless of excess demesne capacity), each a local to the province being given out. Note that this automatic behavior is specific to multiplayer: in singleplayer, among numerous other differences, you are prompted about each province before granting it.
Remove the 'Recently Acquired' modifier from the province of [Root.job_chancellor.Location.GetName].\nThis will prevent it from being considered by the 'Grant Recently Acquired Land' decision.

You may grant [Root.Location.GetName] to a new steward, [From.Religion.GetPriestTitle], or military governor either of your own culture and religion or of the local provincial culture and religion, if different.
You may grant [Root.Location.GetName] to a capable, new [From.Culture.GetName]-[From.Religion.GetName] steward.
You may grant [Root.Location.GetName] to a capable, new [From.Culture.GetName]-[From.Religion.GetName] [From.Religion.GetPriestTitle].
You may grant [Root.Location.GetName] to a capable, new [From.Culture.GetName]-[From.Religion.GetName] military governor.
You may grant [Root.Location.GetName] to a capable, new [Root.Culture.GetName]-[Root.Religion.GetName] steward.
You may grant [Root.Location.GetName] to a capable, new [Root.Culture.GetName]-[Root.Religion.GetName] [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle].
You may grant [Root.Location.GetName] to a capable, new [Root.Culture.GetName]-[Root.Religion.GetName] military governor.
Give it to a random, new leader of my choosing
Would you like to grant [target_prov.GetName] and any owned subholdings in it to a military governor, a priest, or a steward?

You may choose to hire a [Root.Culture.GetName]-[Root.Religion.GetName] leader to govern [target_prov.GetName] at a cost, or you may appoint a local leader from [target_prov.GetName] to govern. Which will it be?
§RWARNING:§! This will put you in debt.\n
This gold WILL be transferred to the new governor.\n
Appointing a local governor costs no gold.\n
[Root.GetChancellorName] §Y[Root.job_chancellor.GetFirstName]§! is deployed to improve relations in a recently-acquired province.\n
Spare §Y[This.GetName]§! from automatic land distribution.\nThe recently-acquired modifier will be removed from the province.\n
Grant §Y[target_county.Location.GetName]§! to my kin and councilor ([This.GetJobTitle]), §Y[This.GetTitledName]§!.
This province has been recently acquired and qualifies for automatic land distribution.
